result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:49 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Deiss, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Jeffrey Scott Viner in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Jeffrey Scott Viner.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file and notes this matter was scheduled with Judge Nordstrand but Judge Needham is hearing case for today.  Atty Schutte states there will be a waiver of PH, this will need to be scheduled for a trial but asking to schedule a STC a month out.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Atty Schutte updates court; has received Discovery, is not quite done, asks for 45 days, no objection by the State. Atty Schutte would like to modify bond to a signature bond so that money can be returned to the DE to have funds to help with discovery process. Atty Rockow is not the Atty on the case, it is a victim crime, would like Atty Schutte to file Motion. Atty Schutte to file Motion to Modify. Adjourned:  2:08 pm.

Felony Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 2/17/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km
Order for payment on March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

AMENDED

$10,000 on file

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, H.V.L., J.V.L. or their residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Status conference on February 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, H.V.L. or their residence or any minor under 18 years of age.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:54 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Kaitlin Dippolito with Travis Satorius for today  DF:  Jeffrey Scott Viner appeared from jail by video means. Defendant does not qualify for PD- PFAC given. Court advises of charges and possible penalties. Court enters NG plea and reserves on pre-plea rights. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets STC to see status of atty and for further scheduling. Atty Satorius states there may be an issue regarding speedy prelim. Adjourned at 2:02 PM.  gll  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.
